title: Google Sheets Functions

metadata.description: Learn about Google Sheets Functions with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title:
Google Sheets Functions

Functions
Google Sheets has many premade formulas
Functions are typed by
For example
content_sections.content:
=SUM
Once you have typed the function name you need to apply it to a range.

content_sections.title: For example
content_sections.content:
=SUM(A1:A5)
The range is always inside of parentheses.

content_sections.title: Description
Returns TRUE or FALSE based on two or more conditions
Calculates the average of a range based on a TRUE or FALSE condition
content_sections.content:
=AVERAGEIFS
Calculates the average of a range based on one ore more TRUE/FALSE 
conditions
=COUNT

content_sections.title: Counts cells with numbers in a range
content_sections.content:
=COUNTA
Counts all cells in a range that has values, both numbers and letters
=COUNTBLANK

content_sections.title: Counts blank cells in a range
Counts cells as specified
Counts cells in a range based on one or more TRUE or FALSE condition
Returns values based on a TRUE or FALSE condition
Returns values based on one or more TRUE or FALSE conditions
Returns the highest value in a range
Returns the middle value in the data
Returns the lowest value in a range
content_sections.content:
=MODE
Finds the number seen most times. The function always returns a single number
=OR

content_sections.title: Returns TRUE or FALSE based on two or more conditions
content_sections.content:
=STDEV.P
Calculates the Standard Deviation (Std) for the entire population
=STDEV.S
Calculates the Standard Deviation (Std) for a sample
=SUM

content_sections.title: Adds together numbers in a range
Calculates the sum of values in a range based on a TRUE or FALSE condition
Calculates the sum of a range based on one or more TRUE or FALSE condition
Allows vertical searches for values in a table
content_sections.content:
=XOR
Returns TRUE or FALSE based on two or more conditions

★
+1

options:

and the functions name

=
and the functions name'.

quiz.question: What is The range?
options:
typed by
=
and the functions name
quiz.explanation: The correct definition of The range is 'always inside of parentheses'.

summary: This tutorial covers Google Sheets Functions concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use Google Sheets Functions effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of Google Sheets Functions and how to apply it in your projects.
